title: QR-Codes of Temial-Teamachine
content:
I have a tea-machine that reads QR-Codes and brews the tea accordingly. I want to generate my own codes.

I have the following codes (and more):

Copy/Paste of the C-Column 

L7UMQRQCQAZBD
OYXPVAANAB4ZE
K4BCLQEFABBRE
F5IKJLYGABSJE

I tried a few different decoding mechanisms, but I didn't get any readings that would make sense to me.

I expect to get numbers for the time and temperature brewing. The name of tee. The number of times the same tee can be used to brewâ€¦

Edit:

All the codes as text: 

VORWERK2AE4L7UMQRQCQAZBDERMYRTHWFKD7CM7PKMBOVEAUNE5WNISNWAIZT74WOLVSSHNSRUIHUWGKFUWKTNXXKI
VORWERK2AE4OYXPVAANAB4ZEER3V2QO4WL6DZGBPBIJWY3AOLKJRXNICEWXVGO6CEKNCKJHFPUPTB3R3EG5YTFTQQE
VORWERK2AE4K4BCLQEFABBREESWJ5KYBTINVAZWZ4SQ5AQUWFAZO3UPYAKOLO2HRIJNFNGXENAW3QU5IXRSKO5BFMI
VORWERK2AE4F5IKJLYGABSJEETKQTQVEY73L4SOLWW5P5NLB355G6BVHINON755S6ADUEBXUV3AFW2JQOWGCHT6CME

comments.text: Hi, and welcome to RE.SE! Please include all text as text (styled as code if needed) instead of as an image, it'll be easier to manipulate and work with samples that way.

For reverse engineering without inspecting the software you need more samples. But even with more samples you may need a lot of tries before you are able to identify the correct algorithms and parameters. Check also reversing projects of devices from the same manufacturer. But in the end having a real firmware for reversing will save you much time.

exactly what I'm looking for: D I only scanned a 10 pack of red berry tea and you can see that even the marked area is always a bit different. NNX, NLX, NJX ..... here a variety as codes VORWERK2AE4NNXNZLQOABOZKETESBPTW3HNXITX55IXE4KQ7BT2I6Q5V2BDN7AOLUMWSQVLRI7WWWS4XSHANQZCO3M VORWERK2AE4NLXNZLQOABOZKESRYZSM4ZIUIVBUUDE6SBIVRNAFULFXBLLM7GNRZHL7EVWLOFHVWXVEBBEIBH3XCDA VORWERK2AE4NJXNZLQOABOZKEROUGUS7AMCX7557OJOEDQUHYZ4RPFAAIXW257QTULKSTP254FYP3HRDX5HR66MDQM VORWERK2AE4NHXNZLQOABOZKERFXN7N
I can provide you with "used" sample data if you want
I still don't know how to do this. I tried all algos I could find.
